Award.AwardTitle: Request for Supplemental Funds for the 18th International Conference on II-VI Compounds and Related Materials

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
The Centers of Research Excellence in Science and Technology (CREST) program provides support to enhance the research capabilities of minority-serving institutions through the establishment of centers that effectively integrate education and research. CREST promotes the development of new knowledge, enhancements of the research productivity of individual faculty, and an expanded presence of students historically underrepresented in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics disciplines.

The CREST Center for Interfase Design and Engineered Assembly of Low-Dimensional Systems at City University of New York (CUNY) City College requests National Science Foundation support for the 18th International Conference on II-VI Compounds and Related Materials.
II-VI semiconductor compounds are composed of a metal from either group 2 or 12 of the periodic table. The scope of the conference spans synthesis techniques, investigation of new physical phenomena and innovative device development. Specific topics that will be covered include growth, characterization, structure, physics and devices of II-VI and related compounds.

This conference has been a significant contributor of modern science and technology since it was established. Ground breaking research in the growth and characterization of materials and design and implementation of new devices of interest in medical, military or imaging domains has been carried out since the conference began. The recent strategic importance of solar cells based on II-VI compounds and the development of new materials with related fabrication properties have increased activity in this field with enormous potential, and has led to a surge in interest in the conference worldwide.

This conference will provide a unique forum for researchers from two CREST Centers (CUNY and University of Puerto Rico, Mayaguez) to expand and promote the Centers' collaborations and allow CREST Center students and faculty to interact in a unique global research environment. Student participation will be encouraged through the availability of travel support and a student presentation competition.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This project was to assist in the organization of an international research conference on II-VI semiconductor materials research and their applications, and in particular, to enable a large number of student participants to attend and participate in this Conference. The Conference is part of an International Conference series, which occurs bi-annually, and it is the primary venue for the dissemination of research findings in the field of II-VI compound semiconductors and their applications. The previous conference of the series was held in Paris, France in September of 2015. The PI and co-PI of this grant are also the Conference Chair and Program Committee Chair. San Juan Puerto Rico was chosen as the venue. The co-PI is also the director of the NSF CREST Center IDEALS, at the City College of New York.

 

Unfortunately, Hurricane Maria, which struck Puerto Rico with devastating strength on September 21, 2017, forced us to cancel the conference within days of its planned start date. As a result, permission was requested for the grant to be used to help defray the costs of the dissemination instruments, such as website design and the Book of Abstracts, and to publish a Conference Proceedings in the Journal of Electronic Materials, which has now been published. The citation for the Proceedings is: Liu, X and Shen, A.. (2018). Special Section: 18th International Conference on II-VI Compounds and Related Materials Guest Editors: Xinyi Liu and Aidong Shen.  Journal of electronic materials. 47 (8) 4211 ? 4411.

 

Intellectual Merit: This grant would have enabled a larger participation of students at the conference, with emphasis on the participation of students that are participants in the NSF CREST Center IDEALS, as well as those from the CREST at the University of Puerto Rico at Mayaguez. It also would assist with the costs of invited and plenary speaker participation in the Conference.

 

Broader Impacts: Thirty full length journal articles were published in the Proceedings. These Proceedings are available to the general scientific community, and serve to disseminate the findings that would have been presented at the Conference. Furthermore, students and postdocs that planned to present their findings at the Conference were able to publish their results and develop their professional standing.
